p: Experimental in vitro studies, concerning MICs, minimal bactericidal concentration and time-kill dynamic processes, have reported that there is a possible synergistic effect between the antimicrobial compounds in essential oil [ 96, 98]. These studies were performed testing carnosic acid, carnosol, rosmarinic acid, oleanolic acid, ursolic acid and essential oil, against Gram-positive bacteria ( Staphylococcus epidermidis, Staphylococcus aureus and Bacillus subtilis), three Gram-negative bacteria ( Proteus vulgaris, Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Escherichia coli) and two fungi ( Candida albicans and Aspergillus niger). All reported pronounced antibacterial and antifungal activity (20; 227; 87; 136; 97; 93). It was also found that carnosic acid showed antiviral activity against human respiratory syncytial virus [ 99].
